greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = (k+1)^2*binomial(n,k) (0 <= k <= n).
comment: Binomial transform of the infinite diagonal matrix (1,4,9,16,...).
Sum of entries in row n = (n+1)*(n+4)*2^(n-2) = A001793(n+1).
example: First few rows of the triangle:
maple: T:=(n,k)->(k+1)^2*binomial(n,k): for n from 0 to 11 do seq(T(n,k),k=0..n) od; # yields sequence in triangular form
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Nov 19 2006
ext: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 29 2006
